snippet: “Once Upon a Time in Anatolia,” an award winner at Cannes, directed by the Turkish filmmaker Nuri Bilge Ceylan, is both police procedural and existential meditation.
abstract: Manohla Dargis reviews movie Once Upon a Time in Anatolia, directed by Nuri Bilge Ceylan.
lead_paragraph: “Once Upon a Time in Anatolia,” an award winner at Cannes, directed by the Turkish filmmaker Nuri Bilge Ceylan, is both police procedural and existential meditation.

headline.print_headline: One Search for a Body, Another for Meaning
